meanings.sent1: The impostures of the con artist were finally exposed.
meanings.sent2: She saw through the impostures of the scammer and didn't fall for it.
meanings.sent3: The magician's impostures left the audience in awe of his skills.
meanings.sent4: The impostures of the counterfeiters were like shadows in the dark, hard to catch.
meanings.sent5: The impostures of the swindler were so convincing that many people believed him.

meanings.sent1: The impostures of the charlatan fooled many unsuspecting individuals.
meanings.sent2: He used various impostures to manipulate the situation in his favor.
meanings.sent3: The clown's impostures during the performance had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an imposture, hiding the pain she felt inside.
meanings.sent5: The impostures of the illusionist made the audience question reality itself.
